message: Started off the 115th Congress by reintroducing the REVIEW Act which halts any ‚Äòhigh-impact‚Äô regulation from burdening American businesses while undergoing the appropriate public or judicial scrutiny any heavy cost rule should have. Washington simply cannot continue to bankroll reckless, billion dollar regulations on the backs of hardworking Americans.

Burdensome regulation is one of the greatest hindrances to growing jobs and the economy. Specifically, regulations rushed in at the last-minute without proper oversight can cause significant damage to business.   Today, the House passed the Midnight Rules Relief Act to ensure no lame duck president circumvents the will of the people or their representatives in Congress through midnight rule making. House Judiciary Committee

It's official. Donald J. Trump will be the 45th President of the United States.  It was an honor to be part of the Joint Session of Congress as they certified the electoral votes today. I would like to thank Vice President Biden for keeping decorum and shutting down any attempts to halt the democratic process.  Congratulations President-elect Trump! #MAGA

I write this today with a heavy heart filled with grief and a gratitude words cannot describe. Today is Law Enforcement Appreciation Day and yet again we have news of another senseless murder of one our dedicated officers, this time in Orlando, FL.   Our men and women in blue make a decision every day to put their safety and security behind that of our own. They deserve our utmost respect and appreciation. I will continue to back our law enforcement officers and fight the rise in aggression towards them. Thank you for all that you do. #BacktheBlue #LawEnforcementAppreciationDay

The American people sent a clear message in November - they are sick and tired of business as usual in Washington.That is why  I introduced 3 bills this week to make sure we get rid of the status quo.   These pieces of legislation will create term limits for members of Congress, institute single subject legislation and provide assurance that good bills passed out of committee make it to the House floor for a vote. We must return our government to one truly for the people, by the people.

Obamacare is failing, plain and simple. Families are suffering under the immense weight of increasing premiums and a lack of quality in care. Republicans ran on repealing this legislation and it is a promise we intend to keep.   We will not, however, repeal #Obamacare without offering an avenue for truly affordable, patient-centered healthcare. Today‚Äôs vote lays the framework for fulfilling our obligation to the American people in offering real relief from this burdensome legislation.
Today, on #MLKDay, we honor the life and legacy of Martin Luther King Jr.   "I have decided to stick with love. Hate is too great a burden to bear."

It's inauguration week in Washington. Too often, we get caught up in the politics of it all, but in reality, this is not a political matter. The peaceful transition of power is a truly remarkable event that many nations never have the good fortune to see. It should be cherished and respected.   I encourage everyone to take a moment and think about the truly exceptional occasion that is the inauguration and the democratic process it represents. America remains the greatest nation in the world and I am excited for the future before us.

All life is precious and should be fiercely protected. That is why I support H.R. 7, #prolife legislation that ensures no taxpayer will be forced to fund abortion.   This legislation makes the Hyde Amendment permanent - a policy that has saved over 2 million lives across America and more than 119,000 in Pennsylvania alone.
(Literally) cleaning up Washington as quickly as I can!

President Trump hit a home run with his SCOTUS pick.  Neil Gorsuch represents a return to the constitutional principles our government was founded on - principles our leaders in Washington seemed to have forgotten in recent years.
Punxsutawney Phil let us down. Six more weeks of winter. #NotMyGroundhog
I met with some of our local bankers in Williamsport to discuss how we can help our small businesses continue to grow and succeed.
Today, I stopped by the PAWS for Love event hosted by the ASPCA.
I stopped by the White House to see President Trump.
I got many good questions from constituents last night in Williamsport.
Many of us have a friend or family member with a rare disease. Please join me in continuing to support research and development for all rare diseases.

I look forward to working with the president on more legislation that replaces Obamacare with a more cost effective and patient centered plan, ensures that those entering our country are doing so the right way, provides our middle class families much needed tax relief and works to bring jobs back to our country.
I was happy to stop by the Central Pennsylvania Food Bank in Williamsport. The Central Pennsylvania Food Bank does a tremendous job of helping to feed our neighbors who are most in need!

I always enjoy meeting with business and industry leaders in my district. I met recently with representatives from the Innovative Manufacturers‚Äô Center, Northeastern PA Industrial Resource Center and local manufacturers.  Reducing overreaching government regulation and providing a level playing field is crucial to these businesses. I am proud to have these vibrant industries in Northeastern and Central Pennsylvania!

Our military men and women deserve to know that we have their backs. We have the greatest military in the world, with the best trained men and women.  It is vital that we continue to provide them with the necessary resources to ensure their continued success.

Good luck to teacher Ryan Monoski from the Montgomery Area School District on his classes participating in the 14th Annual-Capitol Hill Challenge. This year, approximately 14,000 students will compete in all 50 states, in every congressional district. The Capitol Hill Challenge is a national middle and high school competition that uses the SIFMA Foundation's award-winning, curriculum-based Stock Market Game(tm) to aid students' understanding of the global economy, become college and career ready, and improve their knowledge of math, economics, and business.
I was awarded the Spirit of Enterprise Award by the US Chamber of Commerce.  I am proud to support legislation that helps our businesses create good paying jobs.
Frank is always on duty in our office. Happy National Puppy Day!
Our Postal Service workers are some of the hardest working people that I know.  I am proud to be there to support them every step of the way.
Congrats to Jennifer Wahl, a social studies teacher at Loyalsock Township High School, who was named one of only 12 finalists for Pennsylvania Teacher of the Year.

We are hosting a joint Service Academy Informational Session at Clarks Summit Elementary School.   The event is set to take place on Wednesday, April 19th from 6:30 p.m. to 8:30 p.m. and is open to all interested students and their families.

‚ÄúDue to a critical illness in my family, I have, with regret and the utmost respect, informed the White House that I must withdraw my name from consideration for Director of the Office of National Drug Control Policy. I thank the President for the enormous honor of considering me for this lead role in the effort to address one of the most pressing issues facing our nation and my state today: the opioid epidemic. I will remain in Congress and continue to support President Trump in whatever way I can.‚Äù

For six years, Obamacare has failed the American people. I have been a vocal leader in efforts to repeal this failed health care law.  The AHCA is a vast improvement over Obamacare and it will give the American people the freedom to choose their own health care. As a three time cancer survivor, and the father of someone living with Cystic Fibrosis, I am proud to vote for a bill that continues to protect the most vulnerable Americans.
I always enjoy visiting and speaking with students in the district. Thank you Williamsport High School for the great discussion.

I am pleased to join my colleague in introducing H.Con.Res. 58 to recognize May as Cystic Fibrosis Awareness Month. My daughter Chloe lives with Cystic Fibrosis and I have done everything I can to make sure she receives the best care possible so she can live a long and prosperous life. I hope that by bringing awareness to Cystic Fibrosis we can find a cure for not only this disease but all other rare diseases.
It was a great Memorial Day weekend.
Kidney disease has touched the lives of millions of Americans, including myself, and this bill is a step in the right direction to better understand the disease and find a cure.
It is important to me that we give all of our law enforcement professionals the proper tools and resources to protect themselves. I am happy justice was served for Eric Williams.

Though our nation, and our politics, has become increasingly divided over the years, there are some issues that still unite both sides of the aisle. Caring for Americans living with kidney disease and kidney failure has been one of those unifying issues. I urge my colleagues in the House to join us in safeguarding the health of Americans with kidney disease, just as Congress promised to do so many years ago.

I am deeply saddened by the shooting this morning during the Republican team's practice for the Congressional Baseball game. My family and I are praying for those who were injured and grateful to law enforcement who ran into harms way.

I applaud the Trump administration‚Äôs decision to withdraw the Waters of the United States regulation.  This was an egregious overreach by the EPA and the Army Corps of Engineers that would have expanded the agencies power to impose restrictions over waters and lands used by farmers, ranchers and landowners.

Congratulations to our PA-10 Congressional Art Competition winner Samia Campbell of Williamsport.  Her piece, ‚ÄúAlisha,‚Äù will be displayed in the U.S. Capitol for one year and she was honored today during an awards ceremony the U.S. Capitol Visitor Center in Washington.
I joined thousands of our fellow Americans on July 4th to celebrate the birth of our great nation at the ‚ÄúSet the Night to Music Fireworks Extravaganza‚Äù in downtown Williamsport.

I unequivocally condemn the hatred and violence that happened in Charlottesville.  Regardless of who commits a  crime, they should be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law.  We Americans are better than this and we will not tolerate hate crimes from anyone.  I am pleased that the Department of Justice is aggressively working the investigation to see that justice is done and the message is received by all the thugs, rioters and haters out there.

Champ was inducted into the Little League World Series Hall of Fame 2017. Champ is an avid baseball player and even though he has Down syndrome, he never lets that hold him back from anything he sets his mind to. It is an honor for me to call Champ my baseball hero.

I am deeply saddened by the passing of former Congressman Joseph McDade. His 36 years of service in Congress, hard work and dedication to Pennsylvania‚Äôs 10th District will not be forgotten. My thoughts and prayers are with his family, friends, and all those who knew him.

As a follow up to the statement I released last week, here is an opinion piece published in one of the most reputable publications, The Wall Street Journal

My thoughts and prayers go out to those in New York City. I am deeply saddened by the violence but our country is strong and we will persevere in this time of abhorrent violence.
I sat down with the Sunbury Daily Item yesterday to discuss recent news reports and set the record straight.

A shooting in Lycoming County last night left Officer Nicholas Carrita of Williamsport wounded. I would like to personally thank Officer Carrita for taking action against those who threaten our safety and I pray that he has a speedy recovery. Every day our law enforcement officers risk their lives to ensure that our community is protected. These men and women in blue deserve nothing but our highest praise and support

In November of 1775, a committee of the Continental Congress met at Tun Tavern in Philadelphia to draft a resolution calling for two battalions of Marines able to fight for independence at sea and on shore. On November 10th, 1775 that resolution was approved forming the Continental Marines. Happy 242nd Birthday to the United States Marine Corp.

Happy Veterans Day to all who have served our country. Ì†ºÌ∑∫Ì†ºÌ∑∏  OUR DEBT TO THE HEROIC MEN AND VALIANT WOMEN IN THE SERVICE OF OUR COUNTRY CAN NEVER BE REPAID. THEY HAVE EARNED OUR UNDYING GRATITUDE AMERICA WILL NEVER FORGET THEIR SACRIFICES - President Harry S. Truman

Thanks to Wyalusing Valley Elementary School's 6th graders and their chaperones who visited me at the U.S. Capitol.   They were excellent listeners and asked some really impressive questions too! I am very proud to have such incredible students in PA-10. . Please come to visit us again soon!

Today is an historic day for America as the House passed tax overhauls for our nation for the first time in 31 years.  These overhauls will help middle class Americans and greatly help the state of Pennsylvania.
Today I introduced HR 4458, ensuring taxpayer dollars are not used to settle sexual harassment claims against Members of Congress

Today I, along with Rep. Lou Barletta introduced H.R. 4493, Eric‚Äôs Law, named in honor of fallen Bureau of Prisons Correctional Officer Eric Williams.  Eric was brutally murdered by an inmate while he was doing his nightly rounds at United States Penitentiary Canaan.  In the trial for Eric‚Äôs killer, there was no dispute of guilt with the defense stating that he was guilty ‚Äúbeyond all reasonable doubt.‚Äù The jury deliberated for 5 hours and returned a split decision, with 11 jurors in favor of the death penalty and 1 juror voting for life in prison. The inmate, who was a convicted murderer and already sentenced to life in prison, was sentenced to life in prison for viciously murdering Eric, essentially receiving no consequence for his actions.   Eric‚Äôs Law provides a fix for this miscarriage of justice by allowing an attorney for the government to motion the court to impanel a new jury for the penalty phase only.  Allowing a second jury to have another look during the penalty phase will provide the prosecutor an additional tool if the facts show that the jury system did not work as intended. This approach is modeled after several states that already use such a procedure in death penalty cases, such as California, Arizona and Kentucky.  Eric‚Äôs law will ensure that families of fallen loved ones can get the justice they deserve.

Today I voted in favor of the Conference Report to Accompany HR 1, the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act.  I am proud to have voted for taxpayers to keep more of their hard earned paychecks.  My constituents, and all Americans, deserve relief from our outdated, complex, and burdensome tax code.  The current tax code has stifled innovation, kept wages from rising, and prevented American businesses from being competitive against foreign competitors.  The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act provides middle class families with much needed relief and will grow our economy
This editorial was in the Sunbury Daily Item today highlighting the need for transparency in the sexual harassment settlements that are costing taxpayers hundreds of thousands of dollars
Merry Christmas from my family to yours!  Wishing everyone a safe a happy holiday and especially our troops around the world!
